intro: Volkameria ligustrina var. nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves and stems have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
